[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Secure E-Commerce System (SES) defines authentication, product management, shopping, and order fulfillment requirements.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SES ensures authentication, product browsing, order processing, checkout security, and customer support.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SES integrates with authentication, payment, inventory, and order tracking services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SES provides a structured UI for browsing, purchasing, and order tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SES operates on cloud-based infrastructure supporting desktops and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SES uses React.js frontend, Node.js backend, PostgreSQL database, and Redis caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SES ensures encrypted transactions via TLS 1.3 and HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SES optimizes product searches and transaction processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SES handles authentication, product selection, checkout, and order management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SES supports accessibility and multi-language options.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SES connects to authentication, inventory, payment, and shipping APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SES ensures authentication, product browsing, order fulfillment, and checkout security.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SES is designed for customers, administrators, and support agents.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SES requires internet connectivity for transactions and authentication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SES relies on encryption, cloud hosting, and secure API transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Order Tracking: Monitors real-time order status.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with authentication, payment, and shipping services.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall ensure secure access to product browsing and order tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall authenticate users before allowing product browsing (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall manage shopping carts, process modifications, cancellations, and payments (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow users to TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a structured UI displaying categorized products and transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process searches and transactions within 3 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user profiles, orders, and logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support accessibility and multi-language settings.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with PCI-DSS for payment security.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure security, reliability, and compliance with transaction regulations.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Authentication, product browsing, order placement, and payment security validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, security policies, and customer service guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: E-commerce security standards, PCI-DSS, and UI/UX best practices.
